author: samwilsn
content: I agree that it's absolutely worth pursuing, even if it isn't directly part of the eth1x critical path.

author: pawandhananjay
content: any writeup/resources you can point me towards re this effort? interested to learn more

author: samwilsn
content: I have a small reading list of general background information, but not specific to this effort.

author: kiwi.eth
content: https://medium.com/@pipermerriam/stateless-clients-a-new-direction-for-ethereum-1-x-e70d30dc27aa this is a good intro one

author: samwilsn
content:
https://pdos.csail.mit.edu/~petar/papers/maymounkov-kademlia-lncs.pdf <- The paper that describes the Kademlia protocol.

http://blog.notdot.net/2009/11/Implementing-a-DHT-in-Go-part-1 <- Easy to follow walkthrough of building a Kademlia DHT in Go. Covers most of the basics, and you end up with something functional. 

http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.68.4986&rep=rep1&type=pdf <- Discussion of attacks on the Kademlia protocol, and some mitigation strategies.

author: kiwi.eth
content: Not sure if pawan meant specific to the dht stuff or eth1.x in general ðŸ˜…  both cases covered haha

author: samwilsn
content:
We (Quilt) have been trying to collect useful resources into a repository. PRs welcome!

content: It's probably too broad to pin to eth1x or here, unfortunately.
